title: Under what circumstances is sexual intercourse considered rape?
content:
A man is said to commit rape when he has had intercourse with a woman under any of the following descriptions:

Against her will. Without her consent. With her consent, when her consent has been obtained by putting her or any person in whom she is interested in fear of death or hurt. With her consent, when the man knows that he is not her husband. With her consent, when, at the time of giving such consent she is unable to understand the nature and consequences it. With or without her consent, when she is under 16.
